intro: Hieracium stenoterolepis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and disturbed soils, often forming dense colonies. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a rough texture, and its flowers are yellow with a central disc. It is an herbaceous perennial that can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
